Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2012 04:57PM Mindy703 wrote: Sharon, I was dx'd on the 29th and met with surgeon the 30th, yesterday, seems like forever ago. But i am surprised you have the stage already. I was told they have to do more tests before they could stage it for sure. Oncotype - which is more pathology on the cells themselves MRI- to better asses sizing and location. Also, if there is cancer anywhere else they may have missed (surgeon he doesn't expect this but....) I do this tues the 4th. BRCA testing- They did this in the office but won't get test results for 2 weeks. The surgeon said all this info. will be used to decide the best course of action. He did tell me ultimately the choice is up to me but the test results will give me an insight as to what is the best decision. Like chemo first then surgery or lumpectomy vs mastectomy, ect. I told him I am opting for a BMX with reconstruction. So, he is getting this set up. But while it is being organized and we are waiting on test results , he said I can have time to really think about it. But continue with setting up surgery as not to waste time. He said if we need to stop surgery set up at any time we can. I actually though am leaning towards chemo first then BMX with reconstruction. He said chemo first addresses the whole body and will let us be able to monitor the tumor and see if I am responding to the chemo we use. By seeing if the tumor is shrinking. It will also address other cancer cells IF there are any others in my body. I know everyone has different experiences but I just thought I would share. I want my process to move quickly, like yesterday. I guess we all feel this way. Goodluck and keep me informed. This sight has given me a lot of comfort. I love when I get a return message! Mindy
